In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

Almighty and merciful God, you break the power of evil and make all things new in your Son Jesus Christ, the King of the universe. May all in heaven and earth acclaim your glory and never cease to praise you. We ask this through our Lord Jesus Christ, your Son, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one God, for ever and ever. Amen. (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Our Father Hail Mary Glory Be O Lord our God, You alone are the Most Holy King and Ruler of all nations. We pray to You, Lord, in the great expectation of receiving from You, O Divine King, mercy, peace, justice and all good things. Protect, O Lord our King, our families and the land of our birth. Guard us we pray Most Faithful One. Protect us from our enemies and from Your Just Judgment. Forgive us, O Sovereign King, our sins against you. Jesus, You are a King of Mercy. We have deserved Your Just Judgment. Have mercy on us, Lord, and forgive us. We trust in Your Great Mercy. O most awe-inspiring King, we bow before You and pray; May Your Reign, Your Kingdom, be recognized on earth. Amen.

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

What Is the Christ the King Novena?

The Solemnity of Christ the King was established in 1925 by Pope Pius XI amidst the economic and social upheaval after World War I.

The pope issued an encyclical, Quas primas, extolling the supremacy of Jesus Christ over all peoples for all time.

In the traditional calendar, it falls on the last Sunday in October and thus precedes All Saints Day.

In the new calendar, it was moved to the last Sunday of Ordinary Time and thus precedes Advent.

The Christ the King Novena is a nine-day prayer leading up to the Christ the King feastday, to honor Christ‚Äôs lordship of all creation and anticipate Christ‚Äôs reign over all peoples and nations when He returns in glory.
